dialogue_line_replacements.text: ¿A qué hora tú te despiertas normalmente?
dialogue_line_replacements.translation: What time do you normally wake up?

dialogue_line_replacements.text: Desayuno a las siete. Siempre como huevos y plátanos maduros.
dialogue_line_replacements.translation: I have breakfast at seven. I always eat eggs and ripe plantains.

dialogue_line_replacements.text: Salgo a las ocho menos cuarto. Llego al trabajo en carro.
dialogue_line_replacements.translation: I leave at quarter to eight. I get to work by car.

cultural_notes_overrides.formality: In Puerto Rico, meal names differ slightly: 'desayuno' (breakfast), 'almuerzo' (lunch, the main meal), 'cena' (dinner). Plantains in various forms (tostones, maduros, mofongo) appear at multiple meals daily.
cultural_notes_overrides.gestures: Puerto Ricans are expressive about their routines — tapping a wrist for time, miming eating with gusto when describing meals.
cultural_notes_overrides.regional_variations: 'El tráfico' is a major topic in daily routine conversations — Puerto Rico, especially in San Juan, has significant traffic. Commuters often say 'me cogió el tráfico' (I got caught in traffic) as a common excuse for lateness.
